column2:
"As the false king fell, so did Cuent Castle.
Following this, Harriet declared a new capital."

"Because of the confusion regarding the collapse of the
castle, a provisional capital was established in the adjacent city."

"While the relocation of the people was proceeding smoothly,
there was still the matter of who would succeed the late king."

"While there was someone who met the
requirements, she was refusing to agree to it."
"J-just as I thought, it's too soon for me to take the throne! I beg of you Luther! Take my place instead!"
"It is common knowledge that I am ineligible to succeed. There will be trouble if you do not accept."
"Without a successor to the throne, the people will fall into confusion... Harriet, you must take charge of this nation."
"I understand that, but..."
"You'll be okay."
"Perhaps Luther should after all..."
"Guardian... While your words are encouraging..."
"Insistent, aren't we? As I have already told you, I have no right to the throne."
"In an emergency like this, can't you bend the rules?"
"Royalty should be the first to break the law, is that it? The thought never even crossed your mind, did it. I'd expect no more from a fairy."
"Isn't Harriet a bit young? Won't it be too early for her?"
"There's no such thing as too early or too late to take the throne. The important thing is whether one is worthy of it."
"In Es-Ars, to the east, the head of the nation is but a child."
"And to the west, the Divine Queen of Epic took the throne at just 12 years old."
"Age does not matter. What matters is if they are prepared to give everything to their country."
"I am not prepared to do that, and I have no intention to become so. Because of that, and as a result of my self-indulgent magical experimentation, I was stripped of my right of succession."
"However, my sister... Harriet... has that resolve."
"Luther... Guardian..."
"I understand."
"In the name of the late King, I, Harriet Lean Rein Cuent, do hereby proclaim my ascension to the throne."
"Guardian."
"Support us and guide us along the path we must follow. We are in your care."
